content.raw:
The project I'm working on might be of interest, but the changes I made to pepxml.py were simply for debugging purposes.  Basically, I'm using Pyteomics to compile information from a large number of mzML and pep.xml files into a simple database and using this data to simulate MS/MS.  I'm trying to develop criteria to build a smarter inclusion list and simulating MS/MS is much, much more efficient than running a bona fide MS/MS experiment every time I want to test a new model.  Is this something you guys would be interested in?

Brian
